data.title: The Lounge: Angel Perpetuates Really
data.meta_description: 1. Anat and Udi Angel and their family members recently decided to make a significant contribution…
data.text:
1. Anat and Udi Angel and their family members recently decided to make a significant contribution to the Hebrew Real School in Haifa. The donation will be used to establish the “House of the Spirit and Evil” – an innovative campus of study that will suit the educational challenges of the coming decades. A memorial garden will also be set up next to the campus set up in memory of the graduates of the Real School and the graduates of the military boarding school for command who fell in the Israeli systems.

Businessman Udi Angel, is himself a graduate of the school, and lost his cousin the late Joel Angel, also a graduate of the Real School, who served as an armored officer, and fell in the Yom Kippur War in battles on the northern front. Angel was very excited about the class The signing ceremony for the transfer of the donation and emphasized that the recognition of the contribution of the heroes of Israel, thanks to which we continue to develop the State of Israel, along with the investment in future generation education – are the cornerstones for the promotion of exemplary society and excellence in Israel.

The principal of the Reali School, Dr. Yossi Ben-Dov, a member of Udi Angel’s class since their joint studies at the elementary school, noted that the ‘House of Spirit and Evil’ will open at the beginning of the coming school year and will be an open, innovative and inviting campus for students. For students and staff leading the humanities and social sciences at the school.

2. The members of the management of SAP Israel and Microsoft Israel, led by SAP Israel CEO, Satyut Navon and Microsoft Israel CEO Ronit Etad, met this week to discuss cooperation between the companies. A significant part of the meeting focused on the plan to prepare the local data center that Microsoft will open in Israel by the end of 2022 for Rise with SAP.

3. The Minister of Agriculture, Oded Forer, and the Director General of his office, Naama Kaufman-Pess, were guests of Tnuva Dairies in Rehovot, and learned how to prepare for the citizens of Tnuva in preparation for the Tishrei holidays. .

4. A collection of celebrations and good luck for Valentine’s Month birthers: Israeli-American billionaire Haim Saban, wore a paper birthday hat and sat around the celebratory table of Israeli singer Jonathan Margie, who celebrated his 22nd birthday in Los Angeles last weekend. As you may recall, Margie signed an international contract with Saban Music Group and is currently in the City of Angels to advance his international career.

> The family and friends of the businessman Shino Zoarz, former chairman of the Israel Football Association, surprised him on the occasion of his fiftieth birthday at a party held in Eyal Shani’s living room.

> Barak Rosen celebrated his birthday with the extended family on a pampering vacation at the Six Senses Hotel in Shaharut.

> Designer of the boutique events Meital Hirchson, celebrated her birthday with a meticulous and invested production on the eve of ‘Valentine’.

Tal Stern, one of the owners of the ‘Magzino’ culinary group, which also includes the ‘Tony Vespa’, ‘Takaria’ and ‘Zuzubra’ chains, celebrated his 49th birthday this week at the ‘Magzino’ restaurant in Tel Aviv. At the center of the celebration is Dov Navon in his performance “A Good Word,” written by Hadas Calderon.

At the beginning of the week, a conference launching the 11th Prime Minister Ariel Sharon’s National Leadership and Military Thought Chair was held on the campus of Herzliya, marking the 20th anniversary of Operation Defensive Shield. Prof. Uriel Reichman moderated the conference. , President, Founder and Chairman of the Board of Directors of Reichman University, and Prof. Rafi Melnik, Acting President of Reichman University. Meet and discuss:

Maj. Gen. (Res.) Moshe Kaplinsky, who will chair the “National Leadership and Military Thought” named after 11th Prime Minister Ariel Sharon; Major General (Res.) Shaul Mofaz, former Minister of Defense and Chief of Staff; Dr. Dana Wolf, Head of the Law and Defense Division, at the Lauder School of Government, Diplomacy and Strategy, Reichman University; Brigadier General (Res.) Moshe (Chico) Tamir, former Golani Brigadier General; Omri Sharon; Gilad Sharon; Maj. Gen. (Res.) Eitan Ben Eliyahu, former commander of the Air Force; Adv. Yoram Raved, Chairman of the “Arik – Ariel Sharon Leadership Association” and who was Ariel Sharon’s private lawyer and a member of the “Farm Forum”; Maj. Gen. (Res.) Tal Russo and more. The event was signed by the Chief of Staff. To Major General Aviv Kochavi.

6. Fashion designer and entrepreneur Rebecca Hasel-Cohen, founder of the women’s clothing brand LoveShackFancy, hosted a party last Saturday night in honor of her 40th birthday. The coveted location chosen to host the party was the ballroom of the Plaza Hotel in New York City, designed in the Victorian style and painted pink. The bride of joy changed three dresses during the evening and received an exciting greeting from her husband, businessman and real estate developer Todd Cohen. Jay who danced the right crowd of New York City people.

7. On the night between Sunday and Monday, Israel time, the Los Angeles Rams team won the Super Bowl. The Cooper Cup touchdown a minute and a half before the end of the game, gave the Rams a 20:23 victory and a second win in their history. In a game to which all of America was connected, there was also a modest Israeli representation in the audience, in the form of the singer Omar Adam and the creator of ‘Fauda’ – the actor Lior Raz.

On Monday evening, a festive toast was held on the roof of the Gan Ha’ir complex in Tel Aviv in honor of the ascent of the new series “Shalom”, which follows the singer and creator Shalom Hanoch. The series was created by Anat Goren. Came to rejoice with Hanoch and Goren: Keren Gleicher, VP of content for yes Guy Lavie, director of the yes Doco channel, partner of Hanoch Limor Yaron, Rafi Reshef and Nurit Galron, Raviv Drucker, Amnon Levy, Yaron London, Guy Sudri, Yair Nitzani , Hami Rodner and more and more. Hanoch himself sat outside during an episode of the series and at the end surprised those present and spoke.
